dof: spin index ($\uparrow$ and $\downarrow$), valley index (+K and -K valley), layer index (top and bottom layer), and sublattice index (A and B)
Note that the sublattice degrees of free: Note that the sublattice degrees of freedom is suppressed for now and will be stated later.
def_var:
$s$ : spin index   
$\uparrow$ : spin up   
$\downarrow$ : spin down   
$l$ : layer index   
$t$ : top layer  
$b$ : bottom layer  
$\tau$ : valley index  
$+K$ : +K valley  
$-K$ : -K valley  
$\alpha$ : sublattice index  
$A$ : A subllatice  
$B$ : B subllatice  
$k$ : momentum operator  
$h_{s,\tau}$: Hamiltonian for spin $s$ at valley $\tau$

task: Define each term in Kinetic Hamiltonian (continuum version)
Description: Each $h_{s,\tau,l}$ is a 2 by 2 matrix spanned in the sublattice space. For the top layer, $h_{s,\tau,t}= h_{\theta/2}(k)$. For the bottom layer, $h_{s,\tau,b}= h_{-\theta/2}(k)$. $h_{\theta}(k)=-\hbar v_D |\bar{k}| \begin{pmatrix}  0 & e^{i(\theta_{\bar{k}}-\theta)}\\ e^{-i(\theta_{\bar{k}}-\theta)} & 0 \end{pmatrix}$, here $\bar{k}= k-K_{\theta}$
kinetic_symbol: $H_{Kinetic}(r)$ of 8 by 8, which will become 16 by 16
def_var:
$h_{\theta/2}(k)$: Dirac Hamiltonians for isolated rotated graphene layers
$h_T(r)$: interlayer tunneling Hamiltonian  
$k$ : momentum operator  
$r$ : real space operator  
$\theta$ : twist angle  
$v_D$ : Fermi velocity

Description: For each spin, valley, the potential term is described by the interlayer tunneling between top and bottom, $h_T(r)$, which should be kept hermitian
def_var:
$h_T(r)$ : interlayer tunneling at spin $s$ and valley index $\tau$  
$H_{Potential}(r)$ : potential term of Hamiltonian in the real space in the single-particle form.

task: Define each term in Potential Hamiltonian (continuum version)
Description: The interlayer tunneling is $h_T(r)=\sum_{j=0,1,2} T_j e^{- i q_j r}$. Here $T_j=\omega_0 \sigma_0 + \omega_1 \cos(j\phi)\sigma_x + \omega_1 \sin(j\phi)\sigma_y$, where $\sigma_0 = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 \\ 0 & 1\end{bmatrix}$. $\sigma_x = \begin{bmatrix} 0 & 1 \\ 1 & 0\end{bmatrix}$. $\sigma_y = \begin{bmatrix} 0 & -i \\ i & 0\end{bmatrix}$. You should expand the summation
def_var:
$\omega_i$ :  magnitude of interlayer tunneling, i=0,1,2  
$\sigma_0$: Pauli Matrix 0 $\sigma_0 = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 \\ 0 & 1\end{bmatrix}$  
$\sigma_x$: Pauli Matrix x $\sigma_x = \begin{bmatrix} 0 & 1 \\ 1 & 0\end{bmatrix}$  
$\sigma_y$: Pauli Matrix y $\sigma_y = \begin{bmatrix} 0 & -i \\ i & 0\end{bmatrix}$  
$\phi$: interlayer tunneling phase
$q_j$: momentum boost

index: spin index $s_i$, valley index $\tau_i$, and layer index $l_i$
momentum: momentum $k_i$ and moire reciprocal lattice vectors $b_i$
For each operator, the total momentum is: For each operator, the total momentum is the sum of moire reciprocal lattice $b_i$ and momentum with in the first BZ $k_i$
def_var:
$c_{s,\tau,l,\alpha,b}(k)$: annihilation operator with spin $s$, valley $\tau$, layer $l$, sublattice $\alpha$, and moire reciprocal lattice vectors $b$
$\epsilon$ : dielectric constant  
$V(q)$ : bare Coulomb interaction in the momentum space
